result.execSummary:
The defendant Randall Earl Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 2 (two) days time served.
If revoked: Huber release privileges for work ONLY.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges during the period of probation. Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due immediately or an entry of a civil judgment.
Obtain and maintain employment, school, or actively looking.
Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant pays the costs successfully completes the sentence and has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause.
Attend Hunter's or Gun Safety Course.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randall Earl Harris

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Randall Earl Harris in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 2:

Defendant sentenced to serve 100 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 2 (two) days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months: If revoked: Huber release privileges for work ONLY:

    *   Obtain and maintain employment, school, or.
          actively looking.
    *   No firearms; weapons.
    *   No new law violations.
    *   Attend Hunter's or Gun Safety Course.
    *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges during the 
         period of probation. 
         Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due  
         immediately or an entry of a civil judgment.
.
Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant pays the costs successfully completes the sentence and has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause.
.
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights; received and filed.

Defendant Randall Earl Harris in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.  Case calendared for plea hearing.

AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

AS TO COUNT 4:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 37.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Randall Earl Harris in court, attorney J. Dennis Thornton via-telephone.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea. Defense counsel is unavailable for today's proceedings.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant Randall Earl Harris in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Randall Earl Harris in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.   Defense counsel has received discovery and offer. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 37. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Randall Earl Harris in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Brittany Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Any and all motions are to be filed with the court by the final pretrial date. 
Case is adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Randall Earl Harris in court pro-se.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Defendant is public defender eligible. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Jarvis G.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Randall Earl Harris in court.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/9/15 @ 1:30pm
